note.p: Education: St Paul's School; Trinity College, Cambridge; BA (1694/5), MA (1698); Incorporated at Oxford (1699)

Career: Fellow of Trinity (1697); MP for Northallerton, Yorkshire (1705-1713); Commissioner of Stamp Duties (1714-1715); Commissioner of Excise (1715-1735); left manuscripts to Trinity College and his collection of coins to Cambridge University Library
Memberships: FSA; Spalding Society; Brasenose Society
Notes: St Paul's School has birth date of 1675. Proposed by Robert Balle
